metadata.title: CVE-2022-24714 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
Icinga Web 2 is an open source monitoring web interface, framework andcommand-line interface. Installations of Icinga 2 with the IDO writerenabled are affected. If you use service custom variables in rolerestrictions, and you regularly decommission service objects, users withsaid roles may still have access to a collection of content. Note that thisonly applies if a role has implicitly permitted access to hosts, due topermitted access to at least one of their services. If access to a host ispermitted by other means, no sensible information has been disclosed tounauthorized users. This issue has been resolved in versions 2.8.6, 2.9.6and 2.10 of Icinga Web 2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-24714` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

icingacli - 2.11.1-1
icingaweb2 - 2.11.1-1
icingaweb2-common - 2.11.1-1
icingaweb2-module-monitoring - 2.11.1-1
php-icinga - 2.11.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: icingaweb2 package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.11.1-1').
